La Union opens Christmas village in Capitol Hill  Business Mirror

SAN FERNANDO CITY, La Union— Senior citizens, persons with disabilities (PWDs) and pregnant women can now enjoy their visit to the first-ever Capitol Hill.

The mayor of Balaoan town in La Union province has assured the public that she was safe, after being wounded in a Nov. 14 gun attack that killed her father.

item.title: You Can Now Travel to Baguio From La Union in Just an Hour - Female Network
item.description:
You Can Now Travel to Baguio From La Union in Just an Hour  Female Network

IMAGE Charlene J. Owen For those of you who are still looking for the perfect place to spend your holidays, you might want to consider heading north this time. Thanks to the newly opened Anduyan Bridge and the Aringay-Tubao Alternate Road, going to Baguio from La Union and vice versa just got so much easier, which means you'll get the most out of that long drive north! DPWH Secretary Mark Villar / Facebook Inaugurated on November 26 by the Department of Public Works and Highways, the bridge and the complementing alternate road in La Union will cut the travel time from Tuba, La Union to Ben...

item.title: Motorists advised to use new road going to Baguio - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Motorists advised to use new road going to Baguio  SunStar Philippines

TOURISTS going to and coming out of Baguio City and Benguet province are advised to take the newly opened road in Tuba to evade traffic. This, after the Department of Public Works and Highways inaugurated the Tubao-Nangalisan Road in Tuba as an alternate route going to Benguet and Baguio City. With the upcoming Yuletide season, Tuba Municipal Police Station Police Chief Inspector James Acod stated with the newly opened route, travel time from Tubao in La Union to Baguio City is reduced to between 45 minutes and one hour. On December 11, he said there will be a joint cluster meeting together...

item.title: Congresswoman urges Comelec: Place La Union under military protection - Rappler
item.description:
Congresswoman urges Comelec: Place La Union under military protection  Rappler

Following the killings of local officials in her province earlier this year, La Union 2nd District Representative Sandra Eriguel has asked the Commission on Elections (Comelec) to place La Union province under military protection. Story: https://www.rappler.com/nation/politics/elections/2019/218234-sandra-eriguel-asks-comelec-place-la-union-under-military-protection

item.title: Congresswoman: Place La Union under military protection | Evening wRap - Rappler
item.description:
Congresswoman: Place La Union under military protection | Evening wRap  Rappler

La Union 2nd District Representative Sandra Eriguel asks the Commission on Elections or Comelec to place La Union province under military protection. Convict Imelda Marcos posts P300,000 bail to enjoy temporary freedom after being found guilty of 7 counts of graft. A professional Filipino eSports player is banned from a million-dollar tournament in China. Classic holiday song ‘Baby, It's Cold Outside’ is proving too controversial for some stations in the wake of the #MeToo movement. The Ateneo Blue Eagles cruise past the University of the Philippines Fighting Maroons, 99-81, to capture thei...

item.title: Cordillera inflation rises to 5.2 percent in October - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Cordillera inflation rises to 5.2 percent in October  SunStar Philippines

HEADLINE inflation in the Cordillera Administrative Region (CAR) accelerated to 5.2 percent in October 2018, higher than the 5.0 percent in the previous month and the 1.9 percent a year ago. Among the provinces in the region, Kalinga province posted the highest inflation rate at 8.8 percent, the Philippine Statistics Authority (PSA) regional office in CAR reported. It was followed by Apayao with 8.4 percent and Ifugao with 5.9 percent. Apayao posted the fastest year-on-year acceleration rate as inflation increased by 8.2 percentage points compared to the 0.2 percent in October 2017. It was ...

item.title: LOOK: La Union towns put up banners seeking justice for slain officials - Rappler
item.description:
LOOK: La Union towns put up banners seeking justice for slain officials  Rappler

LA UNION, Philippines – Black banners and tarpaulins are displayed along the highway and other areas in the towns of Balaoan and Sudipen in La Union province, calling for justice for their slain local elected officials. On November 14, Balaoan Vice Mayor Al-fred Concepcion was killed with his aide in an ambush. His daughter Mayor Aleli Concepcion was also wounded. Mayor Alexander Buquing of Supiden was killed in an ambush on October 1, along with his driver and police guard. His wife Vice Mayor Joy Buquing was wounded in the attack. Former congressman Eufranio Eriguel and his two bodyguard...

item.title: Travel shorts: Go Hotels opens in Cubao, activities at El Nido and Coron - ABS CBN News
item.description:
ABS CBN News

MANILA -- Still not sure where to travel during the Holy Week break? Here are some of the travel news and promos to guide you. These are not endorsed by ABS-CBN News. 1. Ethiopian Airlines offers 15% off Handout Photo Ethiopia, which recently landed in Lonely Planet’s 2017 travel destination list, is becoming one of the most interesting tourist destinations in Africa. In line with this, Ethiopian Airlines is offering a 15% off promo for online booking of flights between USA, UK and all online points in Africa, the Middle East, and Asia. Flying four times weekly from Manila to Addis Ababa, ...

item.title: Ronnie Dayan Caught In La Union - FHM Philippines
item.description:
Ronnie Dayan Caught In La Union  FHM Philippines

Authorities have finally arrested Ronnie Dayan, the former flame of Senator Leila de Lima in an operation conducted in La Union on Tuesday morning. The elusive fugitive who has been in hiding for months was caught in Sitio Turod, Brgy. San Felipe, San Juan, ABS-CBN News reports. Other accounts say that Dayan was not arrested but rather surrendered, fearing for his safety following the P1 million bounty on his head offered by the Volunteers Against Crime and Corruption. He will be presented by the Philippine National Police later today. Last week, De Lima admitted to having a previous relati...

item.title: Tropical Storm 'Jolina' weakens further, to exit PAR tonight - CNN Philippines
item.description:
Tropical Storm 'Jolina' weakens further, to exit PAR tonight  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, August 26) — As it further weakens, tropical storm "Jolina" continues to bring rain in many areas in Luzon, Saturday morning. The state weather bureau said as of 7 a.m., "Jolina" is already at 75 km west southwest of Laoag City, Ilocos Norte, after crossing northern Luzon overnight. "Jolina" made landfall in Casiguran, Aurora around 8:15 p.m., Friday. "Jolina" has maximum sustained winds of 65 kilometers per hour (kph) and gustiness of up to 80 kph, from a previous of 75 kph and 120 kph, respectively, according to the Philippine Atmospheric Geophysical and As...

item.title: House panel to end Paskuhan hearing - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
House panel to end Paskuhan hearing  Sun.Star Philippines

CITY OF SAN FERNANDO -- The House Committee on Good Government and Public Accountability is set to terminate this month on the third and final hearing the sale of the Philippine Christmas Village (Paskuhan) by the Tourism Infrastructure and Enterprise Zone Authority (Tieza) to Premier Central Incorporated. Pampanga Third District Representative Aurelio “Dong” Gonzales, Jr., who filed House Resolution 654 that called for the investigation of the sale, said they expect to come up with a resolution after the hearing. The third hearing, according to the solon, will be crucial in the next step t...

item.title: De Lima's ex-aide Ronnie Dayan arrested - Rappler
item.description:
De Lima's ex-aide Ronnie Dayan arrested  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines (3rd UPDATE) – Police on Tuesday, November 22, arrested Senator Leila de Lima's former security aide and alleged bagman Ronnie Dayan. Dayan, who supposedly facilitated and collected money from drug personalities in behalf of De Lima, was arrested just before noon in San Juan, La Union. He is currently at the La Union provincial police office. The House committee on justice had ordered Dayan's arrest and cited him in contempt last October 10, after he failed to attend the hearing on the New Bilibid Prison (NBP) drug trade on October 6. On Tuesday, House Majority Leader Ro...

item.title: Ex-La Union town vice mayor killed in ambush - Rappler
item.description:
Ex-La Union town vice mayor killed in ambush  Rappler

CAGAYAN, Philippines – A former vice mayor of Sto Tomas town in La Union province was killed in an ambush on Wednesday night, April 26. According to reports reaching Chief Inspector Silverio Ordinado Jr of the La Union police information office, Vincent Rafanan, 42, and a certain Beatriz Sakamoto, 31, were gunned down by still unknown assailants in Tavora East village in Pugo town in La Union. Records from Sto Tomas police listed Rafanan as fifth among illegal drug suspects in the area. Senior Inspector Julius Basallo, Pugo town police chief, said the responding team found the bodies of Raf...

item.title: La Union barangay captain turns over P2.1M worth of marijuana to police - ABS CBN News
item.description:
La Union barangay captain turns over P2.1M worth of marijuana to police  ABS CBN News

LA UNION- A barangay captain in La Union turned over to police a sack of marijuana valued at P2.1 million. Barangay Tubaday Captain Pulmano Agadang turned over a sack containing 17 rolls of dried marijuana to the Santol Municipal Police Station. The sack was first discovered along the foot trails leading to Amburayan River in the boundary of Sitio Inasan, Barangay Tubaday and Barangay Sugpon, Ilocos Sur on Thursday afternoon. Agadang said they do not know who owns the sack or who dumped it in the area because the place where it was found could not be reached by vehicles. Police officers bel...

item.title: 1 dead, 7 injured in bus, trike collision - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
1 dead, 7 injured in bus, trike collision  Sun.Star Philippines

BAUANG, La Union – A woman was killed while seven others were injured when the tricycle they were riding was hit by a speeding passenger bus at over the week along the national highway in Barangay Dili. Chief Inspector Joel Lagto, the town’s police chief, identified the fatality as Bernaliza Benitez, 28, a resident of Barangay Sevilla in San Fernando City. Benitez was declared dead on arrival at the Ilocos Training and Regional Medical Center due to severe head and body injuries. Her companions were also brought at the same hospital for treatment. Investigations showed the tricycle (6722 ZJ...

item.title: De Lima's former aide Ronnie Dayan arrested in La Union - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
De Lima's former aide Ronnie Dayan arrested in La Union  Sun.Star Philippines

MANILA -- Ronnie Dayan, the former security detail of Senator Leila De Lima, was arrested in Sitio Turo, Barangay San Felipe in San Juan town, La Union on Tuesday, November 22, according to a television report. BREAKING NEWS: Ronnie Dayan, former driver of Sen. Leila De Lima, arrested in La Union: report pic.twitter.com/ZdS6t5wOBW — SunStar Publishing (@sunstaronline) November 22, 2016 Dayan and Joenel Sanchez, who is also De Lima's security aide, were accused of collecting monthly payola from drug lords inside the New Bilibid Prison allegedly for the De Lima's senatorial bid. In an exclusi...

item.title: Tibaldo: Knowing the Bago or Bagbag-o as Indigenous People (part 2) - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Tibaldo: Knowing the Bago or Bagbag-o as Indigenous People (part 2)  Sun.Star Philippines

IN POBLACION Alilem located within the downstream of the mighty Amburayan River, we attended the Sunday Catholic mass officiated by Fr. Moises Andrada II and the service and homily was in Ilocano. Luckily, my mother was spotted and recognized by an elderly distant relative who was also a former teacher of the place. Uncle Alejo Bangaoil ushered us to his house near the town church which is actually a good example of a Filipino hospitality. Over a cup of coffee, it was inside his house where I discussed further the purpose of our visit adding that we also intend to reconnect with old acquain...

item.title: Holcim plants recognized for energy efficiency - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Holcim plants recognized for energy efficiency  Sun.Star Philippines

CONSTRUCTION solutions company Holcim Philippines Inc. was again recognized during the 2016 Don Emilio Abello Energy Efficiency Awards by the Department of Energy (DOE) as among the large industrial firms that efficiently operate its facilities. The company’s cement plants in Bacnotan, La Union and Norzagaray, Bulacan won Awards of Recognition for representing the Philippines in the ASEAN Competition Best Practice for Energy Management in Buildings and Industries. The La Union plant was cited for its use of alternative fuel and raw materials to reduce its coal consumption, while Bulacan was...

item.title: Smiley holds off Le Clutch, pads IMBL lead - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Smiley holds off Le Clutch, pads IMBL lead  Sun.Star Philippines

SMILEY, sans its captain remains to be the team to beat with three weeks to go in the International Mixed Bowling League Thursday at the Puyat Center when it blasted Budget Savers 19-5 and increase its total to 149.625 another point up on four time defending champion Le Clutch. League president Louie Loy swept IMBL secretary Dolph Lachica, 3-0, even as Rogel Garano and Ed de la Rosa swept Butch Mendoza and Ben Casuga to lead a hot charge of Smiley which now carries a nine point lead on Le Clutch with three more weeks to play before the position night. Smiley captain Marice de Guzman is in t...

item.title: Kennon Road up for rehab under PPP - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Kennon Road up for rehab under PPP  Sun.Star Philippines

THE historic Kennon Road will soon be fully rehabilitated under the public-private partnership scheme of the government. Engineer Alexander Castañeda, chief of the Baguio City engineering district of the Department of Public Works and Highways, said the information was relayed during the coordination meeting of the department two weeks ago in Pampanga. Once materialized, this will mean the full rehabilitation of the 33-kilometer stretch of Kennon Road, which has been experiencing an “open close” status due to numerous problems since after the 1990 magnitude 7.6 earthquake that struck northe...

item.title: Palace suspends gov't office work in Metro Manila, Central Luzon, Calabarzon - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Palace suspends gov't office work in Metro Manila, Central Luzon, Calabarzon  Sun.Star Philippines

MALACANANG on Tuesday ordered the suspension of all government work in Metro Manila, Central Luzon, and Calabarzon due to inclement weather brought about by Tropical Depression Maring. Presidential Spokesperson Ernesto Abella said the suspension of work was made upon the recommendation of the National Risk Reduction and Management Council (NDRRMC). "Upon the recommendation of the NDRRMC, the Office of the Executive Secretary has announced that work in government offices in Metro Manila, Region III (Central Luzon) and CALABARZON is hereby suspended," Abella said. According to the 5 a.m. advi...

item.title: House inquiry on fuel cost disparity sought - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
House inquiry on fuel cost disparity sought  Sun.Star Philippines

BAGUIO City Representative Marquez Go wants the House of Representatives committee on energy to conduct an inquiry into the “alleged disparity and overpricing of fuel prices in Northern Luzon.” Go announced this when he reported on his accomplishments before City Hall officials and employees led by Mayor Mauricio Domogan and Vice Mayor Edison Bilog recently. In House Resolution No. 853 which was currently referred for study by the House committee on energy, Go said there is a prevailing disparity between the pump prices of fuel in the areas of Northern Luzon particularly in the province of ...

item.title: ‘Jolina’ slightly intensifies, to make landfall over Northern Luzon - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
‘Jolina’ slightly intensifies, to make landfall over Northern Luzon  Sun.Star Philippines

TROPICAL depression Jolina is expected to slightly intensify before making a landfall over Northern Luzon between Friday and Saturday, August 25 and 26. The Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical Astronomical Services Administration (Pagasa) said, in its 11 p.m. weather update, that Ilocos provinces, La Union, Abra and Benguet may be raised to Tropical Cyclone Warning Signal (TCWS) No. 1 on Friday morning. Pagasa also said that moderate to occasionally heavy rains is expected in Bicol provinces and other parts of Luzon by Friday. Areas under TCWS 1 are Cagayan, Isabela, Apayao, Kalinga, Mounta...

item.title: House panel sets Paskuhan hearing on Wednesday - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
House panel sets Paskuhan hearing on Wednesday  Sun.Star Philippines

CITY OF SAN FERNANDO--The House Committee on Good Government and Public Accountability will hold the second hearing on the sale of the Philippine Christmas Village (Paskuhan) to Premier Central, Incorporated this coming Wednesday at the House of Representatives. The Committee had confirmed the invitation of former officials of officials of the Tourism Infrastructure and Enterprise Zone Authority (Tieza) who were requested to attend along with former Tieza manager Mark Lapid as well as officials from the City of San Fernando and other provincial line agencies in Pampanga. The same committee ...

item.title: La Union squads lead 2600 Basketball - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
La Union squads lead 2600 Basketball  Sun.Star Philippines

SAINT Louis College of La Union continues their run for the title after topping the eliminations round of the 2600 Basketball. In the elementary division, the La Union based dribblers lead the bracket with three wins after dismantling Easter College and the University of Baguio Laboratory Elementary School earlier. Headstart Play and Learn Montessori and Saint Louis University Laboratory Elementary School are ranked second and third respectively while the University of the Cordilleras and Our Lady of Mount Carmel Montessori are tied at fourth place with one win and one loss each. In the hig...

item.title: Baguio City councilor succumbs to cancer - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Baguio City councilor succumbs to cancer  Sun.Star Philippines

FINAL honors will be accorded to Councilor Roberto Ortega, who was also known as “Bungo,” starting on Tuesday, August 1, at the City Hall. Known to be northern version of the iron hand against crime and drugs and lived his life with the moniker “Markang Bungo,” Ortega passed quietly in the afternoon of July 30, ending his fight against cancer which he kept so as not to worry the public in his hometown at San Fernando City, La Union. Ortega will be brought to the Baguio City Council Session Hall on Tuesday until Thursday for public viewing and after which will be brought back to La Union whe...

item.title: City High stuns SLC La Union in Milo Best hoops - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
City High stuns SLC La Union in Milo Best hoops  Sun.Star Philippines

BAGUIO city high school lit up the three point territory and made one stop after the other to open their campaign in the 32nd SBP - Passerelle Twin Tournament at the Easter College gym. City high scored a decisive 11-2 run in the final frame to halt Saint Louis College-La Union A Saturday afternoon, 73-63, to earn their first victory in the passerelle division in the Milo Best Center backed tournament. Daniel Esgana and Gerald Lapeña conspired to lead City High as they finish the ball game with 17 and 16 points respectively with their squad trailing after the first period, 16 – 19, despite ...

item.title: Pangasinan II retains title in R1AA Meet - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Pangasinan II retains title in R1AA Meet  Sun.Star Philippines

BANTAY, Ilocos Sur -- With the results of only three ball games yet being awaited, defending champion Pangasinan II is now in the threshold of retaining its crown in the Region 1 Athletic Association Meet (R1AA) which ends Wednesday afternoon at theQuirino Stadium in Bantay, Ilocos Sur. On Wednesday morning, only four gold medals separate Pangasinan II with second-running Dagupan City, last-year's R1AA second placer. Officials said granting that Dagupan wins in all three games still being played, it will not be enough to topple the defending champion. As of 6:33 p.m. of March 7, Pangasinan ...

item.title: Le Clutch, Pugo play catch on Smiley in local bowling league - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Le Clutch, Pugo play catch on Smiley in local bowling league  Sun.Star Philippines

THREE time defending champion Le Clutch and a seemingly distraught Pugo Adventures, who just missed a podium finish in another sport earlier Thursday, won convincingly to move within striking distance on league leading Smiley which lost on the return of team captain Marice de Guzman from the United States. Smiley could only score nine, including a 0-7 bashing from Twinkle in the first game as the league leader has 158.625 after 20 weeks in the International Mixed Bowling League at the Puyat Center. With second ranked Le Clutch moving to within striking distance and avoid a walk in the park ...

item.title: Red carpet awaits lucky summer visitors in Baguio - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Red carpet awaits lucky summer visitors in Baguio  Sun.Star Philippines

THE Baguio Correspondents and Broadcasters Club (BCBC) will roll out again the red carpet for this year’s "Lucky Summer Visitors" who will be chosen from among the thousands of vacationers on Maundy Thursday, April 13, under the long-running annual tourist tribute project of the media group. BCBC president Jane Cadalig said preparations are in high gear for the various activities from the setting up of the media camp at Camp Peppot at Burnham Park on Monday to the selection of the visitors in Rosario, La Union on Thursday and their send-off on Easter Sunday. In the previous years, visitors ...

item.title: Tropical Storm Jolina makes landfall in Aurora - CNN Philippines
item.description:
Tropical Storm Jolina makes landfall in Aurora  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, August 25) — (UPDATE) Tropical Storm Jolina (international name: Pakhar) now crosses Quirino province after making landfall in Aurora early Friday evening. As of 10 p.m., the Philippine Atmospheric Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration (PAGASA) said Jolina was spotted in the vicinity of Maddela, Quirino, with maximum sustained winds of 80 kilometers per hour (kph) and gustiness of 110 kph. It is forecast to move 19 kph northwest, and expected to exit Luzon on Saturday morning. Jolina made landfall in Casiguran, Aurora around 8:15 p.m. READ: NDRR...

item.title: Temporary relief from truck ban proposed - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Temporary relief from truck ban proposed  Sun.Star Philippines

THE CITY Council Committee on Public Utilities, Traffic and Transport Legislation will recommend to the local legislative body a temporary relief of truckers from the full implementation of the city’s new truck ban ordinance. This will give ample time for the council to work on the proposed amendments to the provisions of Ordinance No. 05, series of 2017, otherwise known as the new truck ban ordinance. The proposed stop-gap measure will be submitted by the committee to the local legislative body during its regular session on July 3 to provide the necessary relief to truckers ferrying perish...

item.title: Policeman gets award for returning bag - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Policeman gets award for returning bag  Sun.Star Philippines

SAN FERNANDO CITY -- A policeman from Urdaneta City, Pangasinan, was conferred the "Medalya ng Papuri" (Commendation Medal) after he returned a bag containing documents and bank checks amounting to P200,000 to its owner. Chief Superintendent Reynaldo Biay, deputy regional director for administration of the Police Regional Office (PRO)-Ilocos, conferred the award on Senior Police Officer 1 Noli Lee Teope, a member of the Urdaneta City Police Station in Pangasinan, on September 18. The awarding ceremony was held at the PRO-Ilocos Grandstand at Camp Oscar Florendo in San Fernando City. Teope r...

item.title: Villamor returns to Korean Festa - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Villamor returns to Korean Festa  Sun.Star Philippines

CORDILLERA'S most bemedalled athlete is gunning for another stint in the upcoming 2017 Seoul Archery Festa slated July 6 to 12. Archer Charmaine Angela Villamor will seek redemption earning a slot in the Korean joust with an impressive second place finish during a qualifying event held recently in San Fernando, La Union scoring 620 points. Villamor will be joined by other qualifiers from the different parts of the country in the weeklong Seoul International Youth Archery Festa 2017 is organized by the Seoul Metropolitan Government, Seoul Sports Council in cooperation with the Seoul Archery ...

item.title: 11 fishermen caught illegally fishing at San Fernando Bay - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
11 fishermen caught illegally fishing at San Fernando Bay  Sun.Star Philippines

SAN FERNANDO CITY, La Union -- Eleven fishermen were arrested by joint police operatives and Bantay Dagat personnel after they were caught conducting illegal fishing along the San Fernando Bay of Barangay Poro on June 21. The fishermen were identified as Roberto Galvez, 26, Richard Cabato, 30, Joseph Cabato, 42, Marlon Cabuñas, 41, Gabriel Cabuñas, 49, Jeonard Soriano, 27, Gregorio Ramirez, 27, Christian Ramirez, 23, Franklin Ramires, 30, Ernesto Galvez, Jr., 35, and Jaymark Jacildo, 26, all residents of Barangay Pilar, Bauang, La Union. Seized from them were 25 kilos of assorted fish worth...

item.title: Tourism exec: Ilocanos push for international flights in Clark - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Tourism exec: Ilocanos push for international flights in Clark  Sun.Star Philippines

CLARK FREEPORT -- The Clark International Airport (CRK) should mount additional international flights to serve Ilocanos abroad. An executive of the Department of Tourism (DOT) said this during the sixth leg of CRK’s North Luzon Road Show recently held in San Fernando City, La Union. “The Ilocano community in Region 1 (Ilocos) is urging Clark airport to market itself to other carriers to service more destinations, particularly Clark-Honolulu and to other parts of the US,” said Martin Valera, DOT-Ilocos Region director. Ilocano migrants and Overseas Filipino Workers (OFWs) will greatly benefi...

item.title: 'Lawin' begins to leave PH, moving towards China - ABS CBN News
item.description:
'Lawin' begins to leave PH, moving towards China  ABS CBN News

MANILA - Typhoon ''Lawin'' further weakened Thursday afternoon as it moves further away from the Philippines towards the Chinese mainland, state weather bureau PAGASA said. In its 5 p.m. briefing, PAGASA meteorologist Aldczar Aurelio said Lawin was only packing maximum sustained winds of 130 kilometers per hour (kph), and gusts of 160 kph. It continues to move northwest at 22 kph. Tropical cyclone warning signal number 1 remains over the provinces of Ilocos Norte, Ilocos Sur, Abra and La Union. Aurelio said the weather in northern Luzon is expected to improve by Friday morning. Metro Manila...

item.title: ‘Maring’ dumps rains in Central Luzon - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
‘Maring’ dumps rains in Central Luzon  Sun.Star Philippines

CITY OF SAN FERNANDO -- Tropical Depression “Maring” on Tuesday, September 12, dumped heavy rains in Pampanga and six other provinces in Central Luzon, prompting officials to suspend classes in all levels as well as work in government offices. As of 11 a.m., Tuesday, all cities and municipalities in Pampanga declared suspension of classes in both private and public schools, said Pampanga Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Officer Angie Blanco. Zambales Governor Amor Deloso, Nueva Ecija Governor Czarina Umali, Tarlac Governor Susan Yap, and Bulacan Governor Wilhelmino Alvarado also decla...

item.title: Pangilinan: Tales from the other San Fernando - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Pangilinan: Tales from the other San Fernando  Sun.Star Philippines

THERE is another city of San Fernando which is making waves in governance as we speak, following the footsteps of our own City of San Fernando in mastering the art and science of making governance a shared responsibility. I had the opportunity to visit and witness how they do thing in the City of San Fernando, La Union when our Pampanga group went there for a benchmarking activity. While I am quite used to the low-key, down-to-earth mien of our own Mayor EdSa, I was still pleasantly surprised and overwhelmed by his humble counterpart up north in the person of Mayor Dong Gualberto, who is no...

item.title: 424 players start Fil-Am golf quest - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
424 players start Fil-Am golf quest  Sun.Star Philippines

A THIRD of the supposed participants of the Fil-Am Golf Invitational Tournament start their quest Nov. 26, as the 67 year old sports spectacle kicked off at both Camp John Hay and Baguio Country Club courses. Some 424, of the more than 1,200 players will be the first to hit the ball at the par 61 BCC and par 68 CJH courses in what is supposed to be the world’s biggest and oldest amateur golfing event which will also see the return of Baguio pride Kylie Verzosa, the newly crowned Miss International. Verzosa, whose family owns a hotel and restaurant here, joined members of the executive commi...

item.title: Some La Union coastal dwellers stay put as Lawin hits - Rappler
item.description:
Some La Union coastal dwellers stay put as Lawin hits  Rappler

LA UNION, Philippines – Some residents of coastal communities in La Union did not evacuate despite the heavy rain and strong winds brought by Super Typhoon Lawin (Haima). Lawin has since been downgraded into a typhoon, but remains strong. Civic group leader Dexter Estigoy said there were locals in Barangay Taberna who went to fish at 8 pm on Wednesday, October 19, despite being warned in advance that there could be storm surges. The fishermen returned safely at 11 pm before the strong rain and winds peaked. Norberto Herado, whose house lies before the West Philippine Sea, chose to stay insi...

item.title: SMC to build new oil refinery worth ₱1 trillion - CNN Philippines
item.description:
SMC to build new oil refinery worth ₱1 trillion  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, June 13) — San Miguel Corporation (SMC) on Tuesday revealed its plans to build a new petrochemical refinery in the country, worth ₱1 trillion. SMC President and Chief Operating Officer Ramon Ang also disclosed during the conglomerate's stockholders' meeting that the project will be built "somewhere in the South." "Mas stable kasi ang petrochemical products. Ang pricing nila tsaka margin, cracking margin, is more stable and more profitable. And of course, malaki rito yung domestic consumption and napakalaki din ng export potential," Ang said. [Translation: Petr...

item.title: P15-M worth of smuggled rice seized in La Union port - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
P15-M worth of smuggled rice seized in La Union port  Sun.Star Philippines

AUTHORITIES have seized 603 metric tons (MT) of Thailand white rice, estimated to be worth P15.4 million in La Union, the Bureau of Customs said Thursday. Importer Progressive Grains and Milling Corp. initially filed an Import Entry for 7,200 MT of white rice, which arrived at the Port of San Fernando, La Union on December 15. The company paid P46,064,232 worth of duties and other charges before the goods were released. But after 144,000 sacks have been released from the port, Acting Chief Port Operations Officer Jose Guillermo withheld the succeeding releases after it was found that more t...

item.title: #WalangPasok: Class suspensions on October 21 - ABS CBN News
item.description:
#WalangPasok: Class suspensions on October 21  ABS CBN News

MANILA - Several local government units (LGUs) suspended classes on Friday, October 21 due to typhoon ''Lawin." Classes have been suspended in the following areas: ALL LEVELS: Apayao Province Ilagan City, Isabela Ilocos Norte Ilocos Sur Ilocos Sur Governor Ryan Luis Singson also suspended work in all local government and national agencies on Friday. Office work has also been suspended in Ilocos Norte. In its 5 p.m. briefing, PAGASA said Lawin is expected to leave the Philippine Area of Responsibility (PAR) Thursday as it moves towards China. Tropical cyclone warning signal number 1 remains ...

item.title: Balweg: Holy Week by the West Philippine Sea - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Balweg: Holy Week by the West Philippine Sea  Sun.Star Philippines

WHAT a way to spend the Holy Week! But that is what was done. The usual way was the comparatively silent, solemn, even dirge-like observance of ecclesiastical rituals reflected in the violet and black colors in church. But not this year. Right in conservative Bauang, La Union. Even the traditional “pasyon” was not there to be heard in the Quinavite neighborhood along the highway in the direction to the component City of San Fernando. No more were the groupings of elderly ladies expertly chanting Ilocano verses relating of the sufferings that Christ endured from His agony in Gethsemane to hi...

item.title: 311 former druggies finish 6-month rehab in La Union - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
311 former druggies finish 6-month rehab in La Union  Sun.Star Philippines

SAN FERNANDO CITY, La Union – A total of 311 former illegal drug dependents were recognized by the City Government for finishing the six month community based drug rehabilitation during the graduation ceremony held at Ortega gym, Barangay Catbangen recently. The lives of these people changed when authorities urged them to attend the drug rehabilitation program dubbed Lakas ng Pagbabago after being subjected to Oplan Tokhang in several villages July last year. Mayor Hermenegildo Gualberto assured the graduates the support from the city will not stop. “As you graduate today, this is just phas...

item.title: Here's How Some Of Your Favorite Babes Celebrated The New Year - FHM Philippines
item.description:
Here's How Some Of Your Favorite Babes Celebrated The New Year  FHM Philippines

In case you’re still not in the mood to start working, here’s something to rev you up. From Pia Wurtzbach, Ann Mateo, Bea Benedicto, to this month’s muse, Kim Domingo, and more, let your favorite babes reignite the holiday vibes as you check out how they celebrated and welcomed the new year. So sit back, relax, and browse (and make sure the boss is not looking)! Pia Wurtzbach Here’s Miss Universe 2015 breaking the Internet (and breaking hearts) as she and Marlon Stockinger cozy up on Hawaii's shores. [instagram:https://www.instagram.com/p/BOtpZEzFcJo/?taken-by=piawurtzbach&hl=en] Beach-BUMm...

item.title: Dayan hiding in La Union for months: report - ABS CBN News
item.description:
Dayan hiding in La Union for months: report  ABS CBN News

Ronnie Dayan, Senator Leila de Lima's alleged bagman and former driver, had been hiding in Bacnotan, La Union for months, his relatives told ABS-CBN News. Dayan's relatives said he had been hiding in Bacnotan, La Union since the drug issue came out in August, according to a DZMM report by ABS-CBN reporter Lady Vicencio. He reportedly told a sibling, a barangay official, about his desire to surrender to authorities so they asked the Pangasinan Police's provincial director to ensure his safety. The Pangasinan police on Tuesday then went to his hiding place in Bacnotan, where he voluntarily su...

item.title: Provinces under red alert due to Tropical Storm Jolina - Rappler
item.description:
Provinces under red alert due to Tropical Storm Jolina  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – The Department of Interior and Local Government raised on Friday, August 25, alert level Charlie in 16 provinces that are within the path of Tropical Storm Jolina (international name: Pakhar). According to the DILG, the following provinces will be within the 100-kilometer radius of Tropical Storm Jolina's forecast track: - Abra - Apayao - Aurora - Benguet - Cagayan - Ifugao - Ilocos Norte - Ilocos Sur - Isabela - Kalinga - La Union - Mountain Province - Nueva Ecija - Nueva Vizcaya - Pangasinan - Quirino Alert level Charlie is based on Oplan Listo (Operation Plan Alert)...

item.title: Security guard killed in Baguio public market - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Security guard killed in Baguio public market  Sun.Star Philippines

A SECURITY guard of Baguio Market Plaza Multipurpose Cooperative (Bamapcom) was killed while on duty early Tuesday morning by still unidentified assailant. The assailant stabbed the victim before he robbed the cooperative of still undetermined amount of cash. Marylith Pagaduan, Board of Director of Bamapcom, identified the victim as Robert Oficiar, 25, a resident of Tubao, La Union, who worked as security guard in the building for more than four years. "We will miss him since he stayed here for long years," Pagaduan said. The police said one of the glass doors in the building was forcibly o...

item.title: 16 injured in Benguet road accident - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
16 injured in Benguet road accident  Sun.Star Philippines

SIXTEEN passengers including the driver of a van were injured Tuesday morning, July 11, in a road accident while traversing a portion of the Benguet-Ifugao Provincial Road. In police report, the van was passing through the uphill road of Tuidan, Ballay, Kabayan, Benguet when the engine of the vehicle suddenly stopped while on it’s to attend an ordination of a priest in the area. The vehicle, driven and owned by Michael Tampicao, slipped backwards swerved left, rammed and climbed into the boulder on the mountain side, tumbled and rested left side up in the road. Aside from the driver, others...

item.title: La Salle Lipa kicks off NBTC Divison 2 title defense with romp over Isabela Colleges Cauayan - SPIN.ph
item.description:
La Salle Lipa kicks off NBTC Divison 2 title defense with romp over Isabela Colleges Cauayan  SPIN.ph

LA Salle Lipa opened its title defense in the Division 2 of the SM-NBTC National High School Championship presented by Freego with a 61-42 victory over Isabela Colleges Cauayan on Monday at the Mall of Asia Arena. Lawrence Platon had 14 points, 12 rebounds, three steals, and two blocks for La Salle Lipa to start off their campaign in Group 2 of Division 2. Aeron Lupac had 13 points, while Riley Javier chipped in 12 points for La Salle Lipa, which limited Isabela Colleges Cauayan to only four points in the second period. Gabriel Felebrico had 13 points and 13 rebounds, while Joshua Felebrico...

item.title: 5 Bacolod personnel back to work after suspension - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
5 Bacolod personnel back to work after suspension  Sun.Star Philippines

FIVE employees of the City of Bacolod have returned to work after their 60-day preventive suspension issued by Mayor Evelio Leonardia on September 2. City Legal Officer Joselito Bayatan said on Wednesday, November 9, said that Mae Cuaycong of City Planning and Development Office, Edsel Casilagan of Public Affairs and Assistance Division, Pacita Tero, head of Department of Social Services and Development, Diana Besañes of City Health Office, and Ma. Fe Trespuentes Department of Public Services have reported back to their offices on Monday. An administrative case for gross neglect of duty wer...

item.title: 2 Navy ships temporarily docked in La Union - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
2 Navy ships temporarily docked in La Union  Sun.Star Philippines

SAN FERNANDO CITY, La Union -- Two large navy war ships are temporarily docked at Poro Point pier after conducting patrol for several days in Benham Rise due to the Chinese vessels spotted in the area for past months. “We are here to fill-up our logistic requirements like fuel, food, and others, which we are standing by for newly directives ordered from main headquarters, and going back to patrol in Benham Rise,” said Commander Jeff Rene Nadugo, commanding officer of the BRP Ramon Alcaraz. Aside from Alcaraz, the second ship docked at the naval station is the Sultan Kudarat (PS-22). The Arm...

item.title: #WalangPasok: Class suspensions, Friday, July 28 - Rappler
item.description:
#WalangPasok: Class suspensions, Friday, July 28  Rappler

What's the weather like in your area? Report the situation through Rappler's Agos or tweet us at @rapplerdotcom. Please refresh this page for updates. MANILA, Philippines – Here is a list of areas and schools where classes have been suspended for Friday, July 28, due to heavy rain from the southwest monsoon, which is being enhanced by Severe Tropical Storm Gorio. Areas Metro Manila - Caloocan City – all levels (public and private) - Las Piñas City – all levels (public and private) - Makati City – all levels (public and private) - Malabon City – all levels (public and private) - Mandaluyong ...

item.title: Exclusive: Ronnie Dayan surrenders - ABS CBN News
item.description:
Exclusive: Ronnie Dayan surrenders  ABS CBN News

Ronnie Dayan, Senator Leila de Lima's former driver and alleged bagman, has surrendered to authorities in La Union, police said Tuesday. Initial reports said Dayan turned himself at 11:30 a.m. in Sitio Turod, Brgy. San Felipe, San Juan, La Union. Watch this exclusive video by ABS-CBN reporter Lady Vicencio.

item.title: Notorious criminal shot dead in police encounter in La Union - ABS CBN News
item.description:
Notorious criminal shot dead in police encounter in La Union  ABS CBN News

Ariel Ibay, believed to be a member of Omo Crime Group in La Union, was shot dead after engaging police officers Monday afternoon. Rosario Municipal Police Station ROSARIO, LA UNION - Ariel Ibay, believed to be a member of Omo Crime Group in La Union, was shot dead after engaging police officers in a gun fight Monday afternoon. Ibay was aboard a motorcycle when he was apprehended by Rosario Municipal Police Station officers because the vehicle had no license plate and he was not wearing a protective helmet. “Sa halip na maki-cooperate, bumunot siya ng baril at pinutukan niya yung ating trop...
